result.execSummary:
The defendant Lawrence K Bruce was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs, pursuant to 973.047 of Wisconsin statutes.
Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges from 25% of his prison wages, remainder to be paid during his extended supervision.
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 21 days time served as to count.

superMiscConds.notes: Successfully complete any counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

supervisions.notes:
The Court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is advised that as a convicted felon he/she may not carry or possess any firearms.  
No contact with firearms.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lawrence K Bruce in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Defendant Lawrence K Bruce in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
As to count 1:
Statements as to sentencing by state and defense.  Additional statement/s by:Maureen W.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 6 years in the Wisconsin State Prisons, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 21 days time served as to count .  CONFINEMENT of  3 years and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 years  with the following conditions:
     *  Successfully complete any counseling and/or
         treatment deemed appropriate.
     *  Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges from 25% of his prison wages, remainder to be paid during his extended supervision.
     *  No contact with firearms.
     * No contact with the victim.
     *  The Court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence. 
         Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment signed by the defendant and filed.  
     *  Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs, pursuant to 973.047 of Wisconsin 
        statutes.
The defendant is advised that as a convicted felon he/she may not carry or possess any firearms.  
The defendant is advised of his/her appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Wisconsin Abuse Program.
.
Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, credit form, ineligible voting rights form.

Defendant Lawrence K Bruce in court with attorney Vladimir Gorokhovsky.  Defendant Lawrence K Bruce in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to count 1:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered the modifier in count 1, repeater, dismissed.
  Defendant waived  rights and pled guilty.
Guilty Plea Questionnaire, No Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights and Elements of Criminal Offenses - Felonies received.
Defendant examined as to his plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Judgment of Conviction entered.
As to count 2:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, count 2 dismissed.
.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
